meanings.definition: The original or earliest version of a text, especially a literary work.
meanings.sent1: I found the urtexts of the famous novel in the library.
meanings.sent2: Scholars study urtexts to understand the evolution of literature.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that the urtexts were so old, they were written on stone tablets.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a treasure trove of urtexts, each holding a piece of history.
meanings.sent5: The urtexts of the play revealed the author's true intentions.

meanings.definition: Texts considered to be the most authoritative or authentic in a particular field or discipline.
meanings.sent1: The professor referred to the urtexts during the lecture.
meanings.sent2: In science, urtexts are crucial for building a strong foundation of knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The urtexts of the subject were like the guiding stars for the students.
meanings.sent4: Her wisdom was like the urtexts, guiding us through the complexities of life.
meanings.sent5: The urtexts of the field were like beacons of truth in a sea of information.
